results.title: Alcoholism
results.brief_description: The film portrays alcoholism as a mental health problem and as an illness that can respond to treatment. Demonstrates that the causes of this illness are imbedded personality difficulties often relating back to the early formative years of the victim’s childhood. The film discusses different forms of alcoholism and the different treatment required for each type. The role of Alcoholics Anonymous is covered and a plea made for increased public facilities for the treatment of alcoholics.

results.title: Alcohol: the problem with drinking
results.creator_credit: Sherry James, Don Anderson, Alcohol and Drug Dependency Board of Tasmania and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The problem of teenage/adolescent drinking. Discusses some of the reasons why they drink, their attitude towards alcohol, and some problems associated with drinking. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Alcohol: the first decision
results.creator_credit: Don Dickerson and King Screen Productions
results.brief_description: Surveys what young people are confronted with when deciding whether or not to drink, including seeing their parents drink, seeing advertisements for liquor in newspapers, magazines, and on billboards, and hearing alcoholism made a subject for levity on radio and television.

results.title: Alcohol: a new focus
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck, American Educational Films and Directions Unlimited
results.brief_description: Points out that everyone, at some time in his life, has to decide whether or not to drink, how much to drink and under what circumstances. Looks at the historical facts of the temperance debate, drinking traditions and effects of alcohol on the body. Builds up a case against unwise drinking habits. Narrated by James Brolin.

results.title: Alcohol. Cigarettes. Marihuana
results.brief_description: Compilation of three short films with each film following a similar pattern describing extent of use through the community, and physiological, psychological, social and cultural aspects of that use.

results.title: Alcohol, tobacco and drugs versus physical fitness
results.creator_credit: George J. Holland and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Stresses a positive approach to avoidance of drug abuse in young people by associating exercise and physical health with the ‘good life’. Young people are shown cycling, back-packing, skiing and surfing. The effects of stimulants and depressants on mental and physical performance are discussed.

results.title: Alcohol is our problem (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Why do young people drink? This video examines some of the influences. Interviews with young people, parents, youth workers and a psychologist provide an insight into the issues and suggestions for overcoming the problem.

results.title: Alcohol is our problem
results.brief_description: This video examines the pressures - peer group, media, parents and adults - and reasons why some young people drink alcohol. Interviews with young people, parents, youth workers and psychologists provide an insight into these issues. Suggestions for overcoming the problems are put forward.

results.title: Alcohol and tobacco: what they do to our bodies
results.brief_description: Laboratory tests are used to show the effects of alcohol on the human body. A comparison is made of the skill and ability of a juggler and an athlete before and after smoking and drinking.

results.title: Alcohol and the human body
results.brief_description: Explains the source of alcohol in liquours produced by fermentation from wheat, grapes, corn and other plants. Diagrams show what happens to alcohol in the human body, how it deadens the judgement centres, affects the vision, slows up muscle responsivenss and may result in unconsciousness. The problem drunkard is diagnosed as a sick person requiring medical treatment. Alcohol is shown to be a social problem as well as a personal health issue.
